==German== ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|de|gmh|[[hōchzīt]], [[hōchgezīt]]}}, from (only plural) {{m|goh|hōhūn gizīti||high celebration}}. ====Pronunciation==== * {{IPA|de|/ˈhɔxˌt͡saɪ̯t/}} * {{audio|de|De-Hochzeit.ogg|Audio}} * {{hyphenation|de|Hoch|zeit}} ====Noun==== {{de-noun|f}} # [[wedding]], [[marriage]] {{gloss|a ceremony in which people are married and/or a celebration thereof}} #: {{ux|de|Die '''Hochzeit''' der Oscar-Preisträgerin war tagelang Hauptthema in der Klatschpresse.|The Oscar award winner’s '''wedding''' was the main topic of the yellow press for days.}} # {{lb|de|card games|in [[Doppelkopf]]}} Both queens of clubs; used in a player’s announcement that they were dealt both queens of clubs and that the first player to win a non-[[trump]] [[trick]] will join their side #: {{ux|de|Ich hab '''Hochzeit'''. Der erste Fehl geht mit.|I have '''both queens of clubs'''. The first non-trump joins me.}} ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-f|en}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Elefantenhochzeit}} * {{l|de|Goldhochzeit}} * {{l|de|Hochzeitssuppe}} * {{l|de|Hochzeitstag}} * {{l|de|Silberhochzeit}} * {{l|de|Vogelhochzeit}} ====See also==== * {{l|de|Ehe}} * {{l|de|Heirat}} ===Etymology 2=== {{compound|de|hoch|Zeit|t1=high|t2=time}} ====Pronunciation==== * {{IPA|de|/ˈhoːxˌt͡saɪ̯t/}} * {{audio|de|De-Hochzeit2.ogg|Audio}} * {{hyphenation|de|Hoch|zeit}} ====Noun==== {{de-noun|f}} # [[heyday]], [[height]] #: {{ux|de|Es war die '''Hochzeit''' der Azteken.|It was the '''heyday''' of the Aztecs.}} ====Declension==== {{de-decl-noun-f|en}} ===References=== * {{R:Duden}} * {{R:DWDS}} [[Category:de:Marriage]]
